Posts.Content: Hello to all, I wish to say thank you for all the information, support and help many have you have offered thru my battle with PC. Many nervous and frightful nights I would come here to read, calm my nerves and return to bed. I assume there are many like me who never bothered to register and fight alone, but still come here for hope and assurance, and for that I am grateful. At age 47 I had blood in my urine. Next day received a DRE and a PSA test and was prescribed Cipro. 3 days later my PSA was a 10.0 3 months later my PSA was 10.2 and I was sent to Urology. 2 weeks later my Urologist did another DRE and thought he felt something and set appointment for a biopsy. The following week I had a biopsy, with 3 of 12 cores testing positive for PC at 3+3 Another PSA 10.2 I consulted with Urologist, Radiologist and Surgeon CT and bone scan negative, no cancer cold be seen. All agreed I could go on AS Received PSA every three months for 1 year 10.1 10.2 10.2 10.2 Urologist recommended another biopsy after one year, I declined and waited another 6 months. PSA's still being done every 3 months 10.2 10.2 At 18 months after 1st Biopsy, Surgeon called and said, I couldn't ignore this and to have another biopsy. Second biopsy tested 9 out of 12 cores positive 3+3 with 10-12 % cancer mass in biopsy. Urologist said AS was now over and I had to make a decision of treatment. Had meetings again with Surgeon and Radiologist. Decided to have the nerve sparing Davinci method by Dr S Conley. Surgery went excellent, she said she spared 95 % of my nerves but lost some as tumor was on the outside of my prostate on a 1 mm patch and required a 2 mm clear tissue. Yesterday I had my catheter taken out after 7 days. Was told my margins are negative, lymph nodes are clean and will have to take a PSA test once every 3 months the first year. The final pathology graded it at 3 + 4. I have almost no drip or leakage, but not much pressure urinating yet. I have not tried to achieve an erection and will start taking small doses of Viagra and doing my exercises. Don't know what the final out come will be, but that's all I have to share as its only been 36 hours after catheter removal. Once again, thanks to all of you for helping me get thru this. PeterG
Posts.Title: My First Post after reading for 18 months

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by wintertexan How is it possible to have negative margins if there was tumor outside your prostate? While in surgery the surgeon noticed a dark spot growing on the outside of my prostate and cut around it by a few mm. The pathology showed the cancer was not past the margin she cut, hence negative margin . That is my understanding. Peter G
Posts.Title: My First Post after reading for 18 months

Posts.Content: Its been one month now. No incontinence, I wear one light pad a day just in case, maybe twice a week I have just a dribble that sneaks by in late evenings when I am tired. No full erections, however a few partials and I managed a dry orgasm , slowly and carefully. Taking Cialis 3 times a week and it sure has made me return to normal size even at a non erect stage. Still too tender to work, I have a physical job, stomache muscles still tender when I exert too much. Best Holiday Wishes to All PeterG
Posts.Signature: Blood test 10.0 DRE and Biopsy 3 0f 12 cores 3+3 AS 2 Years with blood every 3 months, stable at 10.1 2nd Biopsy 9 of 12 cores 3+3 RARP 11/26/13 by Dr. S Conely Catheter out in 7 days Pathology 3+4 1 light pad at 1 week past catheter Continence at 3 weeks no pads PSA undetectable at 7 weeks At 13 Months Erections both with and without meds, its all coming together .
Posts.Title: One Month Since Surgery

Posts.Content: For sure, keep useing a VED, at 18 months its still healing, help it along. Peter

Posts.Title: What do you guys make of this?

Posts.Content: Hey Bricks, The ED was mentally killing me too. Pills, didn't work, The VED hurt, the Trimix sucked, having to inject a needle. So finally I just resigned to masterbation with a floppy for at least dry orgasms. At a year out I was still dead in the water. My Dr kept telling me to calm down as I had lost one bundle but spared the other. All hope was lost. Then........some 13 months after surgery things started to tingle, I felt mild enlargment, then by month 15 post op it started happening again. ERECTIONS !! Now I can do what I did pre op, I still throw in a cialis at times to boost my confidence. I had given up hope just to have my body repair itself. Doc always told me, could take 3 years, but I wasn't a beleiver. Just hang in there, you will be fine. Nerve damage takes time, lots of it. It's a mental screwing when your dick is broken. Just hang in there, you will be fine. At 10 months I didn't feel anything down there. At 15 months I am back in the game. Good Luck and Hang In There. You're Right on Schedule for a Full Recovery ! Best Regards, Peter
Posts.Signature: Blood test 10.0 DRE and Biopsy 3 0f 12 cores 3+3 AS 2 Years with blood every 3 months, stable at 10.1 2nd Biopsy 9 of 12 cores 3+3 RARP 11/26/13 by Dr. S Conely Catheter out in 7 days Pathology 3+4 1 light pad at 1 week past catheter Continence at 3 weeks no pads PSA undetectable at 7 weeks At 13 Months Erections both with and without meds, its all coming together .
Posts.Title: 10 months PSA Undetectable

Posts.Content: What I have noticed. If I push myself to the limit, bucking load of wood, spliting nd stacking it, I risk loseing continence while I sleep and, well you know. If I just split wood for a few hours, I can get spurts. If I am lzy all day I 100 % continent. I think this may be from over working the spincter muscles. As far as sexual drive, at 8 months post Davinci, I am damn near impotent. Its been horrible, but I keep trying and staying the course. Somedays I am gratefull to be alive. Somedays I thing those bastards maimed me. Best Wishes

The leaking thing is probably temparary as he is not contoling the muscles since its been so long since he had a erection. Chin Up I'd tell him............it's ll comming along Peter

Posts.Title: I am Part of the Zero Club

Posts.Content: Great, You sound like you re doing well. 3 weeks out you should start taking the Viagra or Cialis regularly to improve blood flow and prevent atrophy. I take 60 mg of Viagra 3 times a week. And 80 once a week. My understanding was this part of the recovery. I am at 6 weeks and am starting to get spontaneous erections. Well with the meds. You should call you're Dr. and get the prescription dosage and time confirmed. Best Wishes PeterG

Posts.Content: Keep doing your kegals, practice tightening that muscle and your brain will reprogram to do it automatically . I get a drip or two after urinating. That last darn drop. I am with you on the headache on full doses of Viagra. Sounds like your doing good, be patient with yourself. Some of those nerves take years to fully recover . Thanks for the update, PeterG

Posts.Title: Free VED

Posts.Content: Hello George, welcome to the club, but sorry you joined. Good News First, at 47 you have excellent chances of regaining all you're functions. You will more than likely heal much faster than the norm. Getting PC young is double edged, bad that you got it at all, but recovery is easier at a young age. I don't know why you're doctor wants to wait. Perhaps he is just giving you time to come to grips with it. The fact that he is willing to wait is a good indication your life is not in danger. This page is a excellent resource , and once YOU decide the course you want to follow, you can decide. I did AS for 2 years. No regrets, but I had 6 blood tests, and two biopsys during this time. Also didn't have the fear of Cancer as Oncologist said I was safe but to be prepared when it's time as in her words " you are playing this AS game ". I was the same age as you, with similar circumstances. At three weeks out I have very soft erections but am able to orgasm. No meds yet either ! 47 is a huge advantage, all the stats you read lump us all together. With a qualified team you will find you will exceed norms in both recovery, incontinence and ed. Seems all you're questions were answered so best of luck in whatever path you chose. PeterG

Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with Prostate Cancer.

Posts.Content: I am just now having erections without viagra, injections or a VED for the first time in over a year. There is some pain involved. The penis hasnt been stretched in a while, the more regular erections you can get the faster the pain will subside. Suck up the pain with a erection and get as many as you can. Of Course talk to your Dr. You're doing good man !

Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with Prostate Cancer.

Posts.Content: Hello George, welcome to the club, but sorry you joined. Good News First, at 47 you have excellent chances of regaining all you're functions. You will more than likely heal much faster than the norm. Getting PC young is double edged, bad that you got it at all, but recovery is easier at a young age. I don't know why you're doctor wants to wait. Perhaps he is just giving you time to come to grips with it. The fact that he is willing to wait is a good indication your life is not in danger. This page is a excellent resource , and once YOU decide the course you want to follow, you can decide. I did AS for 2 years. No regrets, but I had 6 blood tests, and two biopsys during this time. Also didn't have the fear of Cancer as Oncologist said I was safe but to be prepared when it's time as in her words " you are playing this AS game ". I was the same age as you, with similar circumstances. At three weeks out I have very soft erections but am able to orgasm. No meds yet either ! 47 is a huge advantage, all the stats you read lump us all together. With a qualified team you will find you will exceed norms in both recovery, incontinence and ed. Seems all you're questions were answered so best of luck in whatever path you chose. PeterG
Posts.Signature: Blood test 10.0 DRE and Biopsy 3 0f 12 cores 3+3 AS 2 Years with blood every 3 months, stable at 10.1 2nd Biopsy 9 of 12 cores 3+3 RARP 11/26/13 by Dr. S Conely Catheter out in 7 days Pathology 3+4 1 light pad at 1 week past catheter Continence at 3 weeks no pads PSA undetectable at 7 weeks At 13 Months Erections both with and without meds, its all coming together .

Posts.Title: Who Has a Post-op Ejaculate?

Posts.Content: Hey Bob, I didn't have the same treatment as you but am suffering the same side effects. The Cialis and Viagra are not working well enough to be dependable or enjoyable. I am contacting my Dr today and ask about other options, perhaps you should do the same. Alcohol and some anti deppresants can effect erections as you know.But that all depends on how you were before the treatment and how much you consume. Best Regards Peter

Posts.Title: Brachytherapy and cialis
